course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Discovering Mind and Behavior
course.description: This course introduces the fundamental scientific knowledge about human thinking and behavior processes, and illustrates the relevance of this knowledge to the betterment of human performance and well-being in a wide variety of settings in the society.

reviews.author: AhWai
reviews.title: 好悶但好好grade
reviews.comment_content:
有20 chapters (Quiz 1: ch1-10; Quiz 2: ch11-20)，雖然佢教得悶，但d topics其實都幾得意，亦都可以了解自己更多）
1. Scientific Method
2. Perception
3. Circadian rhythm
4. Consciousness
5. Emotions
6. Memory
7. Learning
8. Rationality
9. Intelligence
10. Creativity
11. Motivation
12. Personality
13. Development
14. Parental Influence
15. Social Influence
16. Abnormality
17. Psychological Discorders
18. Psychotherapy
19. Mind and Body
20. Positive Psychology

雖然多chapters, 但每個chapter嘅ppt都係好少slides (around 30-40 pages)，仲要好多都係survey/research result，同埋有d topics係有關聯，所以唔難背，不過如果想有A+，你最好背到好熟，連圖裡面嘅information都背埋 (p.s. 佢冇考數據，但你都要記得每個survey/research result係咩）

e.g. ch4 Consciousness 有一個圖講examples of the defense mechanisms Freud identified (attached)，你要知每個defense mechanisms有咩分別同埋個examples，佢mid term有一題就係比左個example，問你係邊個defense mechanism

e.g. ch13 Development 有個theory 叫Erikson’s theory (states that individuals pass through eight stages, each of which is characterized by a psychosocial crisis)，佢有個圖(attached) 講晒每個stage所面對嘅issue，你要知佢地嘅分別，佢final有一題就係講一個人反思自己一生，問你佢係面對咩issue (answer: integrity vs despair)
reviews.comment_teaching: 其實都係照ppt讀，冇咩特別，冇咁悶就係上堂成日會播片，同埋有時教到某d chapters，會有心理測驗做 lol 所以可以唔洗去上堂，只要你背得仔細，考試都會冇問題
reviews.comment_grading:
Essay 1: 14/15 (mean: 10.5, high: 15, low: 5)
Essay 2: 11/15 (mean: 10, high: 15, low: 0)
Quiz 1: 48/50 (mean: 38.6, high: 50, low: 13)
Quiz 2: 46/50 (mean: 40, high: 50, low: 21)

最後拎左A+ :) Thanks, Kevin!!
reviews.comment_workload:
都幾輕鬆
- 每個topic都會有assigned reading & suggested reading，主要都係想你了解多d，考試佢會講埋邊幾份reading會考，所以基本上唔洗點理

- 兩個quizzes (30% each; 其實即係mid term & final exam, 全mc (50題)，每個exam都係10 chapters，再加3份指定assigned reading，因為齋背，個mean都唔低 )

- 兩份essays (15% each; 每份都係500字，只會涉及1-2topics，將所學嘅theory/knowledge套用番係自己生活(topic & guidelines are attached), btw 佢開sem仲有一堂係教你點寫reference lol笑左，其實讀得依個course好多都係year4，都唔洗你咁教啦)

- research experience (10%, 要係psy lab 拎3 creds，而每個lab主要都係叫你去一間電腦室做問卷(within 30 mins)，每個lab會有1-2 creds depending on contents，所以要做2-3 psy lab，不過如非必要都唔好register Emotion study，雖然佢係2 credits，但好麻煩，係one week survey (total 35 surveys - 要做夠80%, 5 surveys per day: 每日都有5個timeslots，每個timeslot兩個鐘，兩個鐘之內佢會不定時比好簡單幾題問題比你，問下你當時心情點，當佢send左survey比你，如果唔係30mins之內做，佢就當你miss左一次，但問題係即使我較左notification,佢個app冇notification，搞到我要記住嗰5個timslots，間唔中都要click入去睇下有冇survey =.= 最後唔夠8成，但好彩佢都比1 cred我。不過總括而言，又晒時間又麻煩又唔係多cred。如果佢個app正常番，都可以諗下嘅。

reviews.author: lphjustin
reviews.title: Easy course with good grades
reviews.comment_content: Topics covered in this course: Research Methods, Memory, Learning, Development, Sensation and Perception, States of Consciousness, Intelligence, Personality, Social Psychology, Psychological Disorders, Treatment of Psychological Disorders and Health & Well-being. Most of the PowerPoints are short (about 20-40 pages each) and consist of key concepts only which are easy to understand. Some of the contents are quite interesting, such as the experiments, for example, the Bobo Doll experiment, that were carried out to investigate certain theories related to psychology.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor teaches in a fun way, she is very nice and always smiles when she talks and tries to make the atmosphere very relaxing. You won't fall asleep easily in this class. Also, there are musical warmups in the first 5 minutes of class, a small break halfway through the lecture, and often video clips about some experiments or studies will be shown. Sometimes she will ask students questions about their opinions/thoughts on a topic, and she will give interesting responses.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is as follows:
25% + 25% Mid-Term Exam + Final Exam
20% + 20% Paper Assignment 1 & 2
10% Research Participation
1% + 1% Bonus (Writing Workshop + Guest Lecture)
No taking of attendance required.

Both exams consist of fully MC questions. If you understand the concepts well enough, you can easily score high in both exams. No need to memorize large amounts of points/notes/materials.

Paper assignments are the most difficult part of this course. You need to write an essay of no more than 500 words about a specific topic/issue. Essays need to follow the APA citation format, which is discussed during the writing workshop. Proper citation is required as plagiarism will be checked during marking.

Research participation requires you to take 3 surveys. You need to apply through the SONA system yourself. If you complete all 3 surveys, you can get all 10% of this part, which is easy to achieve.

Finally, there are 2 opportunities for bonus points, one is the writing workshop, and the other is a guest lecture by a counselor.
My results are: above 1 SD in both exams, above 0.5 SD in essay 1, mean in essay 2, final grade is A. Grading is very good in my opinion.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is light, only 2 paper assignments and 2 exams in the whole term. For exams, you only need to study the PPTs, there is no need to study the textbook (although it is recommended). Research participation is easy and only take a max of 1.5 hours in total (just register ASAP for the surveys). Full attendance of lectures is not required, although attending will certainly help you familiarize with the concepts.

reviews.author: rind
reviews.title: Strongly recommended
reviews.comment_content:
Since there is not much information about the new instructors, I would like to give some details before the class enrolment.
A little bit different to the past offerings as Nicolson and Annie are new instructors.
L01 Discovering Psychology
L02 Psychology and Science
L03 Psychology of Learning
L04 Memory and Cognition
L05 Sensation and Perception
L06 Consciousness and Sleep
---Quiz 1---
L07 Developmental Psychology
L08 Personality Psychology
L09 Social Psychology
L10 Health Psychology
L11 Abnormal Psychology
L12 Treatment of Psychological Disorder

Online textbook: Discovering Psychology: A brief Text
https://nobaproject.com/textbooks/annie-shu-new-textbook

Personally I think this is a course I regret i did not take earlier. All topics covered are very important to a HKUST student. Topics on Learning, Memory and Sleep make me reflect on the ways that I used to learn.
Topics on Development, Personality, and Disorders make me better understand myself and truly reflect on our own. We struggles a lot in HKUST, fighting for GPA, internships, competitions, achievements..., we are so busy that we overlook our mental health/stress level. Through a lot of theories, discussions or cases introduced in the course, I truly reflect on my university life, where does my hatred of HKUST comes from, how my childhood experience unconsciously affect myself..., and now I feel like I am doing much better after this course.

OK, enough chicken soup for the soul. I think your experience on this course largely depends on your past personal experience. Nevertheless, the psychological experiments are fun to study. Like bystander effect, how a stranger standing next to a man affects his urination process, Pavlov conditioning experiment, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Instructor: Siu, Nicolson
Since the SOSC department is lack of psychology lecturers, to meet with the great demand for Sosc1960/1980, they decided to switch these courses to be real-time online mode. RTO mode will NOT provide any video recordings.

It is the first time Nicolson is teaching this course. He taught biological psychology and he focus more on neuroscience part. Therefore, sometimes he will provide more extra insight for those parts, but not examined.

The lecture notes are redesigned by Nicolson and Annie, and I appreciate they add many interactions between students and instructors. This is also one reason why they decide to switch to RTO mode. They can gain more feedback from students.

In summer semester, every lesson is ~3 hours. It is very tough for both lecturers and students to focus. You can also see Nicolson's excitement/performance drops through out the class. He ended up reading the powerpoint slide in the end. However, in next lesson, he will revisit the parts he simply read out before and provide more examples and explanations.

His English is very typical HK accent, and he always provide real-life examples to illustrate different concepts. Sometimes he will give "moral of the story": which means how a theory can help us in real-life. I think these are the most important takeaways from this course.

He often asks for student engagement in class and asked if there is any questions. He also held consultation sessions (You can ask in Cantonese). Generally a very helpful instructor.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grades are not out yet. Although both L1 and L2 are using the same assessment material, each session is graded on its own. (I think it is fair, as different instructors may put emphasis on different topics.)

Grading Scheme:
30% Quiz 1
30% Quiz 2
15% Assignment 1
15% Assignment 2
10% Research Experience (P/F)

All statistics comes from canvas

Assignment 2

Then I think my final grade cannot give any evidence that this is a good grade course or not.
reviews.comment_workload:
Each quiz consists of 60 MCQs with 60 minutes of time. You can go backward and all quizzes are open-notes, open-book (the online one). They design the quiz to be speed test rather than difficulty test to prevent cheating. I think if you have attended all the lectures and revised for 1-2 nights, 60 minutes are more than enough.

The syllabus of the quiz claims to include the online textbook, and majority of the questions can be solved solely relying on lecture materials. I think for every quiz 1-2 questions are testing textbook-exclusive material. Like they ask for the catatonic reaction of Schizophrenia in quiz 2 which is not in the lecture notes.

In each assignment, you have to write at most 500 words to answer several questions. Citations are not mandatory. I did not cite anything in my Assignment 1.

Research Experience is easy, just watch a video/do a personality test, and write 200-300 words, then you get the 10%.

The content in this course is generally not difficult. Therefore you can see high median in quizzes/assignments.

---update after assignment 2 grade release---
In my assignment 2, I quote 3 journal articles to support my ideas. I think although providing citation is not mandatory, it gives you higher marks. (Of course you have to quote proper evidence)

reviews.author: Layor
reviews.title: 靚Grade CC for SSC-SA
reviews.comment_content:
一個入門級既psychology course
內容一共分為4個theme，20個topic
因為係入門級既緣故，所以內容唔會太深入，適合啲冇讀過但又有興趣接觸psycho既beginner

Introduction: Why and how scientists study human mind and behavior
#1 Overview: Through understanding human mind and behavior, we can make a better world.  
#2 Scientific method: Scientists use a variety of tools to study human mind and behavior.
好搶手既CC，因為咁我係喺第一個禮拜之後先wait到依個course，所以我冇上過依兩堂，不過依兩個topic唔洗考所以都冇咩好留意

Theme 1: How we experience the world
#3 Perception: What we see is not always what exists.
#4 Circadian rhythm: A lot of things happen in our body and mind while we sleep.
#5 Consciousness: Our experience of the world is governed by both the conscious and the unconscious.
#6 Emotions: There are universality as well as cultural differences in our emotional experiences.
#7 Learning: It is possible to make wolves retreat from sheep and to train pigeons to play ping pong.
幾有趣既topic，主要係講我地點樣去認識世界

Theme 2: How we solve problems
#8 Memory: Forgetting and false memory can be traced back to how memory is formed.
#9 Rationality: It is not always easy to make a rational decision, as we are bounded by capacity and motivation.
#10 Intelligence: IQ scores are useful, but they fail to cover the many abilities that are important to success.
講知識方面既野

Theme 3: Why we behave in the way we behave
#11 Motivation: A number of needs, some basic and some higher-order, direct and energize our behavior.
#12 Personality: Personality, when properly assessed, can predict a lot of things about a person.
#13 Development: We are who we are because of what we were born with and what we experienced growing up.
#14 Parental influence: Our parents shape who we are in both visible and invisible ways.
#15 Social influence: Our behavior is often influenced by actions by other people.
講一個人的行為係社會同家庭既影響下形成

Theme 4: The dark and bright sides of our functioning
#16 Abnormality: The boundary between what is normal and what is abnormal is fuzzy.
#17 Psychological disorders: A better understanding of mental illness may reduce the stigma around it.
#18 Psychotherapy: Therapists use a number of psychological techniques to treat psychological disorders.
#19 Mind and body: A healthy mind boosts a healthy body.
#20 Positive psychology: Happiness brings success, health and even longevity, but it has dark sides.
講一啲心理上既問題同疾病，仲有心理治療既方法

Btw，除左lecture之外仲有recommended readings，入面既內容唔會考，所以可以當係read for fun
reviews.comment_teaching:
幾有passion既一個professor，好容易follow到佢講既野，基本上只有上過一次堂就可以明白到大部份既野

除此之外堂上間中會播下片（例如一啲experiment)，可以當係加深對內容既理解，所以雖然唔take attendance但都幾推薦去上堂

值得一題既係佢既ppt slide有時會比我地有既多幾張hidden slide，所以有上堂既可以學多啲野咁（不過多果啲內容似乎冇喺quiz到考，至少我上果個sem係）
reviews.comment_grading:
Research experience (5% x 2)
Essay (20%)
Reflective writings (5% x 2)
Quizzes (30% x 2)

Research experience有兩份，分別係research exercise同research study。前者要你design一個experiment，後者需要參加一份survey然後寫返reflection，兩份都係P/F scale，合格就有齊5分，所以基本上人人滿分

Essay上限800字，值得注意既係essay除左要引用一啲research findings之外，可以講多啲點解會有咁既findings

Reflective writings，200字既reflection，主要寫你喺依個course學左啲咩，4個theme入面總共會有4份writings，當中揀兩份寫，grading都係P/F計，所以建議做左頭兩份writings先，咁樣如果fail左任意一份都仲有兩份比你做（不過一般冇人會fail，都係基本上人人滿分）

Quiz有兩份，non-cumulative，Quiz 1 (Topic 3 to 10), Quiz 2 (Topic 11 to 20)，MC + open book，問既內容幾易同straightforward，因為內容唔難所以mean好高，不過基本上只要ensure你每堂lecture都follow到既話唔難高分/滿分，最緊要小心唔好有careless

Score for reference
Essay: Mean (15.70/20, SD 4.01)
Quiz 1: Mean (25.33/30, SD 3.37)
Quiz 2: Mean (25.92/30, SD 4.22)
reviews.comment_workload:
雖然好似好多assignment（2份reflective writings + 2份research experience + Essay），但其實每份既word limit好低，除左essay要800字上限之外，其他都係200字上限

Essay方面可能要花多少少時間（因為要引用source），而且時間接近midterm period，最好早少少準備

Quiz因為係openbook既關係，只要平日有上堂既其實一日已經夠溫（當然aim high既話最好用多少少時間），問題形式係MC，問題通常會比個case你然後問你依個係咩野concept
Example: Someone afraid of snow after he experiences avalanche, what kind of learning process does this illustrate?
A) Classical Conditioning B) Operant Conditioning C) Obersavation Learning... etc
所以溫書既時候最好每一個concept都識得舉一反三，確保自己明白example同concept既關係

reviews.author: Kelvin
reviews.comment_content: 個人覺得個course既內容都幾得意，好似將你平時有既common sense整合返咁，由perception, 到learning and memorization既process都有介紹，都係一d日常生活經常會接觸的課題。
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor幾乎每堂都會係lecture播d experiment，有d都幾有趣，而佢講解亦唔悶，所以幾enjoy上lecture。
reviews.comment_grading: 讀既時候year1，可能未了解common core的考試模式或者應該點讀，所以grade出黎得C+....總分應該係below mean少少，唔算好爛grade不過都係覺得麻麻，冇平時d人講既咁好grade，可能係professor問題掛。
reviews.comment_workload: workload唔算大，2篇essay各600字都好快寫得完，係midterm同final(course係叫quiz1 and 2)要預備多d，多野背同時要求少少理解。仲有個特別的地方係佢要求要參與4次每次半個鐘的psycho research，填下問卷咁，計10% grade。

reviews.author: 燃燒中的GPA
reviews.title: Interesting course
reviews.comment_content:
20 lectures, one topic on psychology for each lecture.
The topics are interesting and closely related to daily life.

For Quiz 1:
#01 Scientific Method
#02 Perception
#03 Circadian Rhythm
#04 Consciousness
#05 Emotions
#06 Memory
#07 Learning
#08 Rationality
#09 Intelligence
#10 Creativity

For Quiz 2:
#11 Motivation
#12 Personality
#13 Development
#14 Parental Influence
#15 Social Influence
#16 Abnormality
#17 Psychological Disorders
#18 Psychotherapy
#19 Mind and Body
#20 Positive Psychology

Quiz 1 and Quiz 2 are non-cumulative.

Note that some topics are interconnected. For example, if you fully understand the concepts in #04 Consciousness and #07 Learning, you will understand #17 Psychological Disorders and #18 Psychotherapy easily.

The question distribution in Quiz 2 was more uneven than that in Quiz 1. The two more important topics in Quiz 2 for this semester were #13 Development (6 MCQs) and #17 Psychological Disorders (7 MCQs).
reviews.comment_teaching: Lecture activities are interesting. Funny videos, personality tests, surveys, etc. These activities help you understand the concepts better. Sometimes the concepts in the lecture slides are quite abstract. You may not understand those concepts by just reading the lecture slides. Kevin makes good use of the lecture activities to explain the concepts well. Therefore, attending lectures is highly recommended, although it is not mandatory.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1 (30%): 40 MCQs, 50 minutes
Mean: 28.15 (out of 40), SD: 7.20

Quiz 2 (30%): 40 MCQs, 50 minutes
Mean: 30.26 (out of 40), SD: 6.89

Essay (20%): 500-700 words
Mean: 15.24 (out of 20), SD: 3.48

Learning Reflection (10%): no more than 400 words
Mean and SD are not announced. (Actually you may assume the mean is 8, see the attachment.)

Research Experience (10%): do some questionnaires to earn 3 credits
(1 credit = 3.33%, 2 credits = 6.67%, 3 credits = 10%; almost everyone will receive full 10% here.)


My scores:
Quiz 1: 39/40 (+1.51 SD)
Quiz 2: 38/40 (+1.12 SD)
Essay: 18/20 (+0.79 SD)
Learning Reflection: 9/10
Research Experience: 10/10

Overall: 94.75%
Final grade: A+


It seems that you have to get at least 1 SD above mean in both quizzes if you want to get an A range, as the quizzes weigh 60% of the course grade. The two quizzes, rather than the essay, will play the dominant role in determining your course grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Preparing for the quizzes is not difficult. Going through all the lecture slides and extra slides (provided during lectures) is enough. Note that a few questions in the quizzes are based on the extra slides (Don't skip lectures if you want to score high!). Most of the questions are conceptual, i.e. testing whether you can understand the concepts / distinguish between different concepts. Not much memorization of details is required. If you understand all the concepts clearly, you will be fine.

Tips: Each MCQ consists of 4 options. You may anticipate that questions with a set of 4 similar concepts as the 4 options will more likely to appear in the quizzes. Here is an example (created by me):

(#07 Learning) Taking away a child's favorite toy as the result of his misbehavior at school is an example of ...
A. positive reinforcement
B. negative reinforcement
C. positive punishment
*D. negative punishment

I think the workload mainly comes from the essay. The topic of the essay was announced a few days after the add/drop period, and the deadline for the essay was set during the midterm period (Week 8). You have more than 1 month to complete the essay. The essay will probably clash with your midterm(s) if you are a deadline fighter.

Syllabus attached.

reviews.comment_grading:
It's a CCC so never expecting any good grades.
The professor and TAs are procrastinating. For example, we submitted the first assignment on 2/7 and the second on 16/7, each of which accounts for 15%. Now it's 31/7 and we haven't got any grades. It's said that the teaching team wants to discourage you from arguing. The same is true of quizzes, each of which accounts for 30%. It's 40 MCs but it takes them more than a week to grade with bubble sheets applied. They would also make it complex to discourage you from paper checking sessions with the wordplay "for your learning benefits" which means "never expect to argue for marks".
As for the rest 10%, Lai will take attendance randomly with all kinds of tests and written materials, but a TA will also show up immediately and lock you inside the LT right after the quizzes asking you to join their researches if you want your participation mark.
The letter grade has not come out yet. I got +0.8sd in quiz 1 and 1.8 in quiz 2. But now, they just post an 'I' high up there on the SIS, which means 'incomplete', I wonder what their loss will be if they keep the status 'in progress'. I am applying for a program and need the transcript where their 'I' is currently written because of Lai's confusing behavior.
It seems that the teaching team is making you uncomfortable with the psychology tricks they have a good command of.
reviews.comment_workload:
It's a summer course, so don't expect it to be small.
Since I have no gift for social science (actually, I was always failing politics and history in senior high), I decided to adopt the most mechanical way, copying lecture notes by hand over and over again.

reviews.author: Minerva
reviews.comment_content:
- Research Methods
- Memory
- Learning
- Sensation and Perception
- States of Consciousness
- Intelligence
- Development
- Personality
- Health Psychology
- Social Psychology
- Psychological Disorders

Easy and interesting :)
reviews.comment_teaching: Her voice is very clear. I really enjoyed her teaching. Of course, attending 3 hours lectures was tiring, but at least it was not "torturous." Plus, she is willing to answer every student's questions, so if you have questions, don't hesitate to ask her!
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1 30% (like midterm)
Quiz 2 30% (like final)
2 Assignments 15% for each
Attendance 10%

I got
1.8 sd above on Quiz 1 (mean: 20.74, sd: 4.23),
1.6 sd above on Quiz 2 (mean: 21.49, sd: 4.25),
mean on both assignments, and full attendance.
The final grade was A.

The quizzes are pretty easy. Just reviewing lectures notes is enough. However, if you aim at A range, I recommend you to read required readings (textbooks). You don't have to read all; just read the parts related to the contents taught in class only.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. Going to the lectures, doing the assignments, and preparing for the quizzes. That's all. But be careful! Quiz 1 comes after first 2 weeks and Quiz 2 after the next 2 weeks... Don't think you have a plenty of time to prepare for the quizzes. Also remember you have assignments as well.

reviews.author: cheese
reviews.title: Not as good grade as everyone has been saying
reviews.comment_content:
Everyone has been saying that this is a good course. As a newbie who heard the rumour and benefits of this common core course, my friends and I enrolled in this course together in summer.
The content is pretty interesting and simple ideas are presented to guys with no psychology background.
Topics: Sleep, Hypnotization, Growth, Memory, Learning, Personality and psychology in social perspectives.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The young and smart professor spoke in fluent English and didn't give us a headache. You may need to fill in some blanks in the powerpoints during lectures. But she taught the topics in an interesting manner so that you wouldn't easily fall asleep.
\
However, there are no tutorials so that you don't know how to complete the assignments that fit their judging criteria. Not until the last moment would you know how did you do wrong. Nonetheless, no corrections are available, resulting in low marks.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading method and judging criteria are unknown. It seems that some tutors may mark your assignments with a higher result preferably. Like I said, there were no tutorials, you ended up don't know why your assignments would get low marks.

Besides, some students may have studied psychology before and they know pretty well on finishing the assignments. Unlucky for my friends and me.

We get about mean and that is a C+. Not B- as everyone has been saying. Though some super guys got A range with super knowledge. you may need to work hard on that.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are only two assignments and quiz on powerpoints.
The workload is pretty low. But the hard part is that you need to find out how to finish the assignments properly.

Attendance is taken through iPRS, making up around 10%. Both quizzes contribute 30%. And the assignments contribute 15%each.

reviews.author: twinkle
reviews.title: a course not so good as described
reviews.comment_content:
Quiz 1:
introduction
Research method
memory
learning
social psychology
sensation and perception
Quiz 2:
states of consciousness
intelligence
development
personality
health psychology
psychological disorder
Quite basic knowledge in psychology, but I don't see any practical value
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor has a fluent spoken English with hardly any local accent.
But she just read out ppt.
Meanwhile, I have to mention that the lecture notes were not organized well. The descriptions of some concepts were quite different from those on the textbook. I doubt the instructor has never amended the lecture notes since she started teaching this course.
Additionally, the lecture notes only cover less than half of the content on the textbook.
reviews.comment_grading:
So so.
Quiz 1(30%) 25.5/30 above mean 0.93 SD
Quiz 2(30%) 27.75/30 above mean 1.58SD
Assignment 1(15%) 13/15 above mean 0.3SD
Assignment 2(15%) 14/15 above mean 1.71SD
Attendance(10%) 10/10
Overall: 90.25%
Still didn't got A+
It seems that most of the A range are As, while A+ and A- just take up an extremely small percentage.
I also heard many good students got B range in this course. I think the grading is not good.
reviews.comment_workload:
A little bit heavy.
The assignments require a lot of references and concrete examples. You need to cope with the topic comprehensively in order to get a good mark.
Since the lecture notes only cover about 1/3 of the content on textbook, you have to spend plenty of time reading the textbook. Each chapter has 40+ pages on average. Please note that the last lecture(psychological disorder) combines two chapters on the textbook. The total number of pages of the required reading for this lecture is 80+ pages, but the instructor assigned the reading just two days before Quiz 2! I think at least 40% of the quiz questions are based on the content uncovered by the lecture notes. So required reading is really important if you want a good grade!
A REMINDER: please do not get deceived by the sample quizzes the instructor gave!!!! The format of the questions in the sample quizzes is quite different from the questions in formal quizzes!!!

reviews.author: 浪子
reviews.title: 付出少少, 回報多多
reviews.comment_content:
psy 野
Quiz 1 30%
Quiz 2 30%
Assignments 30%
Class Participation 10%
簡單易明,不過要堂堂聽書,加自己睇書
reviews.comment_teaching:
靚女professor ,上過ust 女神secret ,教得又好, 又唔悶,
清楚,簡單,易明, 簡直好夢想般的課堂
當然, 我對psy 幾有興趣
reviews.comment_grading:
超好grade ,especially in summer ,因為d 人都讀得幾chur
利申: A左
mid term : above around 1.5 sd
final : above around 0.6 sd
essay 1 above around 0.9 sd
essay 2 above around  0.9 sd

d essay 輕鬆, 因為佢有比model essay ,用心做, 用多d 佢教的theory , sure win
reviews.comment_workload:
acceptable
mid term + final + 500 words essay *2
不過如果想mid term + final above more than 0.5 sd, must read textbk
her lecture notes are not enough
用問卷take attendance ,要堂堂上.

reviews.author: Emerson
reviews.title: good grade course with interesting content
reviews.comment_content:
Topics
L01 (Discovering Psychology)
L02 (Psychology and Science)
L03 (Psychology of Learning)
L04 (Memory)
L05 (Sensation)
L06 (Consciousness)
L07 (Developmental Psychology)
L08 (Personality Psychology)
L09 (Social Psychology)
L10 (Health Psychology)
L11 (Abnormal Psychology)
L12 (Treatment of Psy Disorders)

Though it is not required, the textbook is helpful if you think the PowerPoint slides are insufficient.
Textbook: Noba Project. (2022). Discovering Psychology: A Brief Text. http://noba.to/3fzdhpnj
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor has a clear voice. He gives many examples and videos to make the lecture more interesting. However, 3 hours of lecture is really hard to concentrate on.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 1: 13.5/15 (15%)
Assignment 2: 12/15 (15%)
Research experience: 10/10 (15%)
Quiz 1: 58/60 (30%)
Quiz 2: 53/60 (30%)

I finally get an A.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. There are two essays you need to write about your experience or observation related to the given topic. The research experience requires you to do an online survey or watch a video and write a short thought piece. The lecture doesn't take attendance. This term is RTO mode, so reading the PowerPoint slides and some textbook is enough for the open book exam.

reviews.author: Kvothe
reviews.title: GOOD A GRADE COURSE, but dont aim too high
reviews.comment_content:
Content was okay la. Honestly no 2 much to talk about. Just read slide and do in-class quiz and you be fine~

Here is list of topics:

#01 Introduction
#02 The scientific method
#03 Statistical thinking
#04 Nature and nurture
#05 The brain
#06 Sensation
#07 Perception
#08 Learning
#09 Memory
#10 Language
#11 Intelligence
#12 Emotion
#13 Judgment and decision making
#14 Consciousness
#15 Developmental psychology
#16 Personality
#17 Social psychology
#18 Psychological disorders 1
#19 Psychological disorders 2
#20 Treatments for psychological disorders
#21 Positive psychology
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think prof is nice and teaches ok. Just drink cofee in bio topic, as she covers 1hr on bio (mind, sensation). Easy to sleep/get lost if not bio major.

ALso on zoom can easy distract by chat.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think grading is gd gd. On mean = b- at least (I have a fd who scored mean on essay + final and he is B-). BUT, advise u not to grade appeal for essay, THTL TA has 0 idea why ur essay gd or bd. she only says random words in sentences 4 why ur essay bad. even if you meet all criteria, useless...

I scored an A- as I did good on final exam, but not so good in essay. 36/40 final, mean 21.

My fd got 39/40 final (class highest 40/40) and 25.5/30 (class highest 28/30, mean 23, sd 3.xx) for essay didn't get A+ in course, so A+ is impossible to get haha.
reviews.comment_workload:
Seems ez course, but mean is rly high for essay.

If u fuck up essay, GG grade. Appeal = 0 use, IK 4 ppl appeal essay and 0/4 get mark change cuz of THTL TA (evil).

Final was open book - no need to revise, just google & rephrase.

reviews.author: Kevin KAI
reviews.title: Just a normal course
reviews.comment_content: The content is very useful in the psychological area. I found that if you are going to study MGMT2110, this course will help you to adapt to MGMT2110.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teacher is beautiful and her English is very good. She always gave us some games and examples to let us get the deep insight into the things.
However, in summer, since you have to take 3 hour class, it is very easy for you to get bored.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is not so excellent as you guys said.
The grade consists of two assignments and two exams.
The assignments are not challenging. Just do it.
The two exams are not easy to let you stand out. Because it is not just examine you about the class materials, it takes a large part to test you about the reading materials and textbooks, and it is very very very detailed. If you want to get an outstanding mark, you need to read the textbooks very carefully and remember all the things.
I get almost 0.5 SD about the two exams, finally I get B+. The grade just normal as I think.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is very small. It is suitable for summer classes.
The only and largest workload is reading textbookds. It depends on you.

reviews.author: Li T
reviews.comment_content:
For people who are interested in psychology, it is a good introductory course. The content are no too difficult, easy to catch up even for those who know nothing about psychology.

Syllabus:
basically 1 topic in 1 lecture (in summer semester)

lecture 1 Introduction
lecture 2 Research methods
lecture 3 Memory
lecture 4 Learning
lecture 5 Social Psychology
lecture 6 Sensation and Perception
lecture 7 Quiz 1
lecture 8 State of Consciousness
lecture 9 Intelligence
lecture 10 Development
lecture 11 Personality
lecture 12 Health Psychology
lecture 13 Psychological Disorders
lecture 14 Quiz 2
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fluent English speaker with no heavy accent. She also explained  some important experiments and encouraged students to discuss with their neighbours (although students seldom did so). Psycho tests were given sometimes as attendance.

But her voice is sharp and might be annoying for some people. Sometimes, she might simply read the ppts and not explaining for certain concepts.

Reading textbook is a must if u want to understand more and get a good grade in quiz.
reviews.comment_grading:
30% for each quiz
15% for each assignment
10% Class Participation

Quiz 1: Mean = 28.52 /40           SD = 5.19   (My score= 35/40)
Quiz 2: Mean = 26.38 / 40          SD = 5.85   (My score= 34/40)
Assignment 1: Mean: 12.43/15   SD=2.43 (My score= 15/15)
Assignment 1: Mean: 10.16/15   SD=1.93   (My score= 10/15)
(Class Participation=8/8)
Final grade: A

The grading was extremely SLOW for assignments. The 2 assignments were handed in on July 2 and July 16, but grades were released in mid August. Not to mention the final grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
No mid terms or finals, only 2 quizzes of 40 MCs and 2 assignments (Essay with not more than 400 words, marks will be deducted even you have 401 words)
You need to manage your time very well in this summer course. As materials in textbook and ppt would be quizzed, but quiz  might held on 2 days after the last lecture, which means that you have not much time to revise and read. (It takes hours to read the textbook)

reviews.author: hoiying
reviews.title: 對psycho有興趣嘅同學可以讀下
reviews.comment_content:
Sosc1960 都算係UST 入面嘅psycho foundation course.lecture基本上都包曬psycho最主要嘅範疇。例如係memory, learning, sensation and perception, consciousness, development, personality 等等。不過都係講得好general唔算太深入, 算係比你稍為認識psychology到底係咩一回事。
Summer 一堂三個鐘, 如果你miss左一堂就等於skip左一個topic, 特別係你唔想買書嘅話更加要上lecture。
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Lai 係local黎, 所以啲英文係好聽嘅。
另外上堂會播唔同實驗嘅片,都幾好睇同容易理解。
不過佢好似後期為左追進度所以就變相教快左好多。
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 30% (above 0.93sd)
Final 30% (above 0.89sd)
Assignment 1 15% (below 0.13sd)
Assignment 2 15% (below 0.17 sd)
Attendence 10% (5/6)
Final grade = B+
我覺得係fair grade 冇講到咁神
reviews.comment_workload:
2個quiz 2份assignments
如果有心想讀好啲係一定要睇書,因為佢會出啲係lecture完全冇講過嘅野出黎。
同埋唔太明佢份assignment想我地點寫lol

reviews.author: a.stupid
reviews.title: Super good grade if you work really hard. But if you are below mean, the grade will be UGLY
reviews.comment_content:
It's about everyday life psychology and its underlying theories. I personally think it is slightly boring, but if you are interested in psychology at first that would be fine.

Course Description
The aim of this course is to introduce the research methods and the fundamental concepts and theories in various areas in psychology. This course is suitable for students who want to acquire a basic understanding of psychology, and prerequisite for students who want to take further courses in psychology.

1. Introduction Ch. 1
2. Research Methods Ch. 2
3. Memory Ch. 7
4. Learning Ch. 6
5. Sensation and Perception Ch. 4
6. States of Consciousness Ch. 5
7. Quiz 1   
8. Intelligence Ch. 9
9. Development Ch. 12
10. Personality Ch. 13
11. Health Psychology Ch. 14
12. Social Psychology Ch. 17
13.  Psychological Disorders Ch. 15 & 16
reviews.comment_teaching: Beatrice speaks fluent and clear English, extremely local friendly. She can explain the concepts very clear and with the aid of real life examples. Videos will be played to facilitate learning and it's somewhat relaxing during a 3 hour lecture (there is a 15 min break in between, super considerate lecturer <3 ). Nevertheless, I just don't find myself focus in class. It's just a bit boring...
reviews.comment_grading:
SUPER GOOD GRADE

**Be ware that it's a big class with 400 ppl enrolled, below mean will easily cost you a C range. But above mean ard 1 sd may get you A range**

Quiz 1: 21/30, above mean 0.2 sd
Quiz 2: 26.5/30, above mean 1.2 sd
Assignment 1: 14/15, above mean 1.8 sd
Assignment 2: 14/15, above mean 1 sd

Overall 86.5%, get A
reviews.comment_workload: My friends share some past lecture slides to me and I start studying two weeks before summer semester starts. And I study pretty hard during the semester. There is a lot to memorize. Do buy the textbook and read the required readings.

reviews.author: Stressor
reviews.title: Good Grade.
reviews.comment_content:
Content is easy.
Research methods, learning, memory, dream, sensation and perception, development, social psychology, health psychology, psychological disorder, etc..

If you are interested in psychology, it is not a big deal.

Caution: Reading textbook is required for quizzes since some of the question would be like" according to your textbook, ........"

Quiz:
non-accumulative
all MC
~40 questions
reviews.comment_teaching:
Notes are provided but there is missing content. Therefore, you should go to class.

She takes attendance almost every lesson with different method, like IPRS, MC sheet, in-class activity.

Sexy voice. Clear accent.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1                                           30%
Quiz 2                                           30%
Assignments (1+2)                       30%                                                                                  Class Participation(attendance)   10%

Quiz 1 higher 0.24 SD
Quiz 2 higher 0.19 SD
Assignment 1 lower 0.2 SD
Assignment 2 higher 0.9 SD
Attendance 10/10
-----------------------------> B
Mean=B
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignment 1:
An essay about 500 words.
A situation and some guiding questions are given.

Assignment 2:
Fill-in a form
about 500 words

reviews.author: st4r
reviews.comment_content: Topic covered include research methods, memory, learning, sensation and perception, state of consciousness, intelligence, development, personality, social psychology, health psychology and psychological disorder. About 60 pages of notes per topic. Most of the topics are interesting and easy to understand. It gives you insight about what psychology is. Videos about some experiment are also shown during lecture.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Its a 3 hours lecture starting at 9 am and 3 lectures per week. It may be difficult for some people to wake up that early during summer but i say worth it. I sit at the front rows. maybe that helped me concentrate and prevented me from sleeping.
Instructor speaks clearly and always try to interact with the class. There's a 15 minutes break midway through the class. You can go to toilet, buy some food or drink, take a nap or ask her questions. She is more than willing to answer any questions. You are also required to read some chapters from the textbook after each lecture. You can borrow the textbook from HKUST library or public library.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1( 30%) + Quiz 2( 30%) + Assignment ( 30%) + Attendance (10%)

Assignment 1: 9/15 (mean: 9.54, SD: 2.6)
Assignment 2: 13.5/15 (mean: 12.03, SD: 2.74)
Quiz 1: 27.75/30
Quiz 2: 29.23/30
Attendance : 10/10
Grade: A

grading is quite good considering the content is not difficult and you have more free time during summer.
reviews.comment_workload: Nearly zero workload. There's only two assignments about research method (designing a research) and memory ( applying principles for something you forgot recently). Research participation is not required. You should follow the format provided and do some citations. Maximum words for each assignment is 500 and you can ask TAs or instructor if you have any questions. The two quizzes are all MC and non cumulative. (first 6 topics for first quiz and the following 6 topics for the second quiz). You have 1 hour to finish 40 MCs and a few of them are from the textbook that you are told to read and they are not from the slides. However, you can probably make an educated guess. The quizzes are easy if you spend time studying the materials. Attendance is taken via iPRS and submitting paper   after finishing the tasks.

reviews.author: Thomas.D
reviews.title: Textbook is not necessary if you want A range
reviews.comment_content: The text book is called Understanding Psychology.  The notes are well prepared and summarized, which makes it very easy to understand the general schemes of this course. Personally speaking, I like to study the ideas related to psychology so I find the materials interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor expresses every concept in the notes clearly and vividly. Each concept is followed by either examples or video clips. Although in summer term the course length was three hours, I didn't feel tired or skip a single class.
reviews.comment_grading:
30% midterm
30% final
30% two short essays
10% attendance

My midterm and final are both above mean.
My two essays are both above mean 1 sd.
Full attendance.
Finally, I got A-. I think the grading scheme is pretty good.
reviews.comment_workload:
I have heard a lot people saying that if you want to get at least A-, you should read the textbook carefully. However, I was too busy (lazy) this summer to read a single page. So I only listen to the lecture and study the notes carefully. To be honest, I think even if you do not read the book, you should be able to get at least 80% of total score. The concepts appear only in the textbook are not that many.
My suggestion is, if you do not want to put much effort and want to get A range, try this way. No textbook, try to be as familiar with the notes as possible. ^_^

reviews.title: Mean = B
reviews.comment_content:
Topics include: psychological research, neuroscience and behaviour, sensation and perception, stats of consciousness(e.g sleep and dream), learning process, memory, cognition and language, intelligence, development, personality, health psychology and psychological disorders.
(Don't be afraid of so many topics. Each topic just consists of one powerpoint slide, which is around 50-60 pages only and they just focus on the virtual side of these topics)

I think this course is great to everybody. Through this course, you can better understand yourself and others and the rationale behind their behaviour.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor lai is a very nice guys and her teaching would force you to be more attentive to her lessons. So don't skip them. The powerpoint slides are clear and concise. However, jotting notes is necessary as you won't understand some of the concepts if you don't attend the lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading consists of several parts:
mid term x2 60% (30%@1)(all mc)
500 words report x2 30%(15%@1)
10% in-class participation (doing simple activities and take the    
                                            attendance)

i got mean in both of my mid terms
1 assignment got mean and another got 1 s.d. above
finally, B. So i think the mean grading in summer should be B.

(If you aim A range, you should buy the textbook because in the first mid-term exam, nearly 25% of the mc questions are related to the context in the textbook. While if you just aim b range, i personally think revising all the powerpoint slides is adequate.)
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the workload in summer is fair. If you pay more effort on it. it wouldn't be difficult to get A range (I guess).
If this course is taken in Fall or Spring semester, i think the workload should be very light provided that you attended the lessons (as attending the lessons help you consolidate and get familiarize the contents so much.)

reviews.author: Cloverrrrrr
reviews.comment_content: The content is the same as the former semesters, and it is quite interesting if you like psychology.
reviews.comment_teaching: Kevin is an amazing teacher! He explains the concepts very clear and gives examples to make sure you fully understand the topic. Also, he and his ta, Vivien, are both willing to give detailed explanation to your questions. They reply email very quickly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Research experience (5% x 2)
Reflective writings (5% x 2)
Nearly everyone got full mark

Essay (20%)
mean: 15.7 SD:4.01
Me: 18/20

Quiz1 (30%)
mean:25.33 SD:3.37
Me: 28/30

Quiz2 (30%)
mean:25.92 SD:4.22
Me: 30/30

Final grade: A

It is a competitive course since everyone got high marks on quizzes and essay. However, if you completely understand the topic you could get nearly full mark.
reviews.comment_workload:
Research exercise and  reflective writings are easy to write but each takes some time to complete.
For the essay, it takes a lot of time to find relative materials and write.
Also, since the lectures are not recorded, you have to attend the real time classes to fully understand the concepts.

reviews.author: aaronic92351
reviews.title: Interesting course, yet normal grading
reviews.comment_content:
Content is basic psychology, interesting as it relates to human behaviors in our daily lives. I sometimes recall the theories learnt in this course as well.

Lecture 1: Introduction (Ch.1)
Lecture 2: Research Methods (Ch.2)
Lecture 3: Memory (Ch.7)
Lecture 4: Learning (Ch.6)
Lecture 5: Social Psychology (Ch.17)
Lecture 6: States of Consciousness (Ch.5)
Lecture 7: Quiz 1 + Research Experience
Lecture 8: Sensation and Perception (Ch.4)
Lecture 9: Intelligence (Ch.9)
Lecture 10: Personality (Ch.13)
Lecture 11: Development (Ch.12)
Lecture 12: Health Psychology (Ch.14)
Lecture 13: Psychological Disorders (Ch.15 & 16)
Lecture 14: Quiz 2

Required Textbook:
Feldman, R. S. (2019). Understanding Psychology (14th ed.). New York: McGraw-Hill. ISBN 9781260194524.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor's English is fluent and explains everything clearly. As the lectures were 3 hours long, she would give a 15-min break every class. She was also patient in responding other students' questions.

Perhaps it was a 9am class and lecture recordings were provided, only one-third of the class actually attended the lectures. Yet I personally didn't feel sleepy attending the class as she explained everything clearly and usually had 1-2 in-class activities per lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1 (15%)
me: 24/30    mean: 23.1    sd: 4.48

Quiz 2 (15%)
me: 27/30    mean: 22.03    sd: 4.23

Assignment 1 (25%)
me: 20.7/25    mean: 19.50    sd: 3.69

Assignment 2 (25%)
me: 16/25    mean: 17.36    sd: 4.48

Video (10%)
me: 10/10    mean: 6.98    sd: 2.17

Research Experience (10%)
me: 10/10 (P/F basis)

Final Score: 82.2% --> B+

As the content are not that hard and the assignments weighted heavier than the quizzes, it may cause you 1-2 sub-grade if you screwed up the assignments.
The grading is just normal.
reviews.comment_workload: Most of the workload comes from revising for the quizzes and completing the assignments. Since it's in the summer semester, there was only around 1 week to finish each assignment since one lecture = one chapter. The video assignment was due after quiz 2, yet you have to edit a good video with appropriate examples and visual aids to score high.

reviews.author: belowmeanguy
reviews.title: Introductory course, mostly common sense and some fun facts
reviews.comment_content:
1. History of psychology
2. The scientific method
3. Statistical thinking
4. Nature and nurture
5. The brain
6. Sensation and perception 1

reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Maria is good, answers almost all the questions in Zoom chatbox every lecture. Lecture slides are also quite well-elaborated. Although attendance is not required, most quiz questions are set quite ambiguously if you only rely on lecture slides. If you pay attention to what her elaboration during lectures, then you would have a much clearer sense of what's happening.

However, she seemed to spend much time elaborating so the second half of the semester were finished quite in a hurry imo. I would like to slow down and learn more about psychology disorders rather than the contents from the first half of the semester.
reviews.comment_grading:
- Research experience 10%
- Learning Journal 20%
- Essay 30%
- 2 Quiz 40% in total

Freaked out when I scored below mean in the first quiz. But Prof Maria said the mean should be the cut off for B+, noice.

First quiz below mean. second quiz above mean but <1 sd, essay above mean again <1 sd. Final grade B+. I'm ok with it, since I didn't really spend time on this course lmao.
reviews.comment_workload:
- 4 Learning Journals (just 50-100 words each)
- 2 Quizzes
- Research experience
- Essay

Learning Journals are just simple assignments used to keep track of students' learning pace I guess. They make sure students are on track with lecture contents. Just write some real-life examples / further elaborate on a topic learnt from previous lectures. It should only take you 5 mins to finish if you paid attention in lectures.

Quiz questions are quite ambiguous and tricky I think. The means for the two quizzes were 12.5/20 and 13.5/20 respectively. 20 MCQ in 30 mins. Since the options are quite tricky, so you don't really have much time to scroll through lecture slides for answers.

Essay is to write about an effective memory strategy, between 500 to 800 words. Easy.

I really hated those who brought take-away breakfast from Cafe to the lecture.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very clear teaching and soft voice. She is very nice.

reviews.comment_grading: As long as you have pay attention to her lecture and read all the required textbook chapters, you should get better than B. Still you need to get a "much higher than mean" in ANY one of the exams and assignments to get an A range. If you take not more than 2 courses in summer it will not exhaust you.
reviews.comment_workload: Still a little bit hard to handle if both textbook and lecture notes were required to read in such a short period of time, especially there were 2 assignments. Memorizing English vocabulary is important as well.

reviews.author: RIbtSU
reviews.title: CGA booster
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction to Psychology
Research Methods in Psychology
Psychology of Learning
Memory
[Tutorial 1] Writing Workshop & Research Experience
Sensation and Perception
[Tutorial 2] Sleep and Biological Rhythms -
Developmental Psychology
Personality Psychology
Social Psychology
Health Psychology
Abnormal Psychology

All topics are not difficult and rather basic. Many of them are actually just common sense. This course is definitely a CGA booster. Strongly recommend this course to fulfill your SSC-SA requirement

SOSC1960 = wash grade course
reviews.comment_teaching:
SIU Nicolson is a local HK person. He is friendly with good teaching. He explains every concept well with a lot of illustrations such as real-life examples. Therefore, if you have attended class, actually there's not much to study.

He is willing to answer students' questions after class. As he is a local, you can just ask him in Cantonese.

The class was very interactive. Nicolson always ask for student's engagement though i didn't answer any of his questions throughout the whole course XD. This style is good because it helps consolidate the concept and remember it.

Though attendance for lectures is not required, there is no recording provided for this course. Therefore, I strongly suggest you attend every class because it is saving your time in doing revision. All the concepts tested in exams are well illustrated during lectures. Though in summer semester, every class lasts for around 3 hours, it is still worth attending all the classes as the exam would be just a piece of cake if you don't skip lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-Term mc Quiz 30%
Assignments 1 & 2 30%
Research Experience 10%
(Task 1 Participate in-class activities (5%)
Task 2 Either Research Study OR Video Exercise (5%))
Final mc Quiz 30%

My score:
Quiz 1:  42/45
Quiz 2:  42/45
Assignment 1:  14/15
Assignment 2:  15/15
Research experience/ tutorial: everyone got full marks

Overall grade: A+  

This course is really not difficult and the contents are not that much. Again to repeat: if you have attended lectures then it's easy to get an A or above.

The exam question type is often a case study: give you a case and choose which concept the case is illustrating. No out-syl questions. Therefore, again, attending lectures is the key to getting A+. The exams are quite easy as it is all MC.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload mainly comes from the assignments. Each assignment requires you to write an essay of 500 words. I spent one day on each assignment. For the essay, make sure your arguments are supported with psychological theories and evidence. The theories need not to be those that are taught in lectures. The citation is in APA style nothing special.

For the exam, again, if you have attended lectures, there's not much to study.

ATTEND the Lecture please if you want an A or above

reviews.comment_teaching:
Nicolson is a local hk person, you can talk Cantonese with him if you want to ask him questions.

He is a funny teacher, he used a lot of examples to teach the theories in class, and those examples are very interesting and really useful for students to understand the concept.

Although this class does not count for attendance, a lot of students are still willing to come to attend his class. He loves interactions, as he always asked questions in class, the questions will not count towards your grades. He is always ready to answer students' questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-Term mc Quiz 30%
Assignments 1 & 2 30%
Research Experience 10%
(Task 1 Participate in-class activities (5%)
Task 2 Either Research Study OR Video Exercise (5%))
Final mc Quiz 30%

I am not sure how will my final grades be like, it is not yet graded. Since a lot of students did well in their assignments and exams, I guess the letter grade will become super strict.
reviews.comment_workload:
As I study this course in the summer sem, I need to attend 3 hours 20 minutes lectures 3 times a week, which I think this arrangement should be the most exhausting part of this course. But no worries, Nicolson is kind and he will understand students need breaks from time to time, so he will just give us a 15 mins break every time when he almost talked for one hour.

However, the assignment and quizzes should be an easy task for you. It only requires 500 words for each assignment, and the final quiz is non-cumulative. If you have a good memory, I think you can start learning the lecture materials 2 days before the exam, and you will still score high.

reviews.author: MYW_8210
reviews.comment_content: - Brief introduction for psychology in several areas, like person's memory and sensation, to different field of psychology like developmental, personality, health psychology, etc, those are mainly focus on investigate people's mind, feeling and behavior in different scenario, ways to deal with abnormal behavior, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is ok, easy to follow as the teacher is local. Only bad thing is the duration of lecture which lasts for 3 hours each lesson. Easy to fall asleep in the class, even easier in an online class.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 assignment each 15%, 2 quiz each 30%
10% Research Experience (P/F)
Quiz 1 mean: about 50/60
Quiz 2 mean: about 46/60
Assignment 1 mean: 12/15
Assignment 2 mean: 11/15
My score of quiz 1 is mean, score of quiz 2 is mean-1,
assigment 1 is 13, assignment 2 is 12,
Assignment is graded by two TAs, to prevent unfairness.
Final grade is B with about mean's grade, which I am pretty satisfied compared to certain courses.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only 2 assignment + 2 quiz + research experience (200 words relection)
The workload is much lower compared to many other courses, only 3 assignment, and each assignment you need to write about 300 words is fine. It is not hard just like writing a short essay in high school, doing it seriously at least gives you around mean score.
You need to complete an evaluation for a research experience, sounds imidating, but what you need to do is just take a survey, or watch a specified video, and write a reflection of about 200 words. The funny part is that it is only graded fail or pass, that means if you don't write anything irrelevant, you get all 10%.
So in conclusion this is a very relaxed course. So I don't recommend you to take it as it has no stress at all.

reviews.comment_content:
Well the other reviews basically covered it all but FYI here are all the topics included in the course

L01 Discovering Psychology
L02 Psychology and Science
L03 Psychology of Learning
L04 Memory
L05 Sensation
L06 Consciousness
L07 Developmental Psychology
L08 Personality Psychology
L09 Social Psychology

Interesting topics, you get a glimpse at different theories and modals in each lecture, so if you are interested in the content itself, I would recommend taking this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Annie is a nice person, however, her teaching style is really boring. Judging off of the only lecture I attended, she basically reads the lecture slides and adds some case studies I personally find irrelevant to the course content. Besides, she talks really slowly and softly, so I couldn't stand attending more lectures of hers.

Note that although the course was delivered online this semester, no lecture recording was provided. I believe recordings were provided in Nicholas's class, but I am not sure about that. Still, you could get by not attending any of the lectures since attendance is not required, and all the information you need is on the lecture slides.
reviews.comment_grading:
It's UST so even if the other reviews say good grading take it with a grain of salt.

Here are my scores for your reference:
Assignment 1 (15%): 13.5/15

Total score: 85/100

reviews.comment_workload:
I'd say not too much workload. The assignments are pretty straightforward, however, the feedback I received was basically ineffectual because the TAs never tell you how to improve, and you never know where you scored the lowest in your assignments. Still, that shouldn't affect the difficulty of the assignments by much.
The quizzes weren't so tough too, I wish I'd put in more effort in an attempt to score better but what's done is done.

The quiz is an open-book, open-note quiz with a combination of multiple-choice questions and true or false questions. Non accumulative.

2 assignments 25% each
required to complete two assignments. The first assignment is about Memory and the second one is about Social Psychology.

Video 10%
illustrate how you can apply a theory/concept from one of the topics to your personal experience.

Research experience 10%
will be graded on a pass/fail basis (for failed cases, students will receive comments and have a chance to rewrite and resubmit with a one-point deduction).
i.Research study:Complete a real research study online as a participant and learn firsthand how it is conducted. Write a thought piece (within 100 to 300 words) about your experience.   
ii.Research exercise:Watch a video about a research study. Write a thought piece (within 100 to 300 words) about the study.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 quizzes, 30 mc each
2 assignments under 500 words
choose any of the concepts learned in the course and make a short video (2-3 mins)

A few questions in the quizzes will test concepts that are not covered in the ppt. However, lectures and ppt are enough for you to do well in the quizzes. Read the textbook if you have time.\

reviews.comment_content:
8 Sep #01 Overview: Through understanding human mind and behavior, we can make a better world.
10 Sep #02 Scientific method: Scientists use a variety of tools to study human mind and behavior.
15 Sep #03 Perception: What we see is not always what exists.
17 Sep #04 Circadian rhythm: A lot of things happen in our body and mind while we sleep.
22 Sep #05 Consciousness: Our experience of the world is governed by both the conscious and the unconscious.
24 Sep #06 Emotions: There are universality as well as cultural differences in our emotional experiences.
29 Sep Essay Writing Workshop
1 Oct (holiday)
6 Oct #07 Learning: It is possible to make wolves retreat from sheep and to train pigeons to play ping pong.
8 Oct #08 Memory: Forgetting and false memory can be traced back to how memory is formed.
13 Oct #09 Rationality: It is not always easy to make a rational decision, as we are bounded by capacity and motivation.
15 Oct #10 Intelligence: IQ scores are useful, but they fail to cover the many abilities that are important to success.
20 Oct Consultation
22 Oct Quiz 1
------------------------
27 Oct #11 Motivation: A number of needs, some basic and some higher-order, direct and energize our behavior.
29 Oct #12 Personality: Personality, when properly assessed, can predict a lot of things about a person.
3 Nov #13 Development: We are who we are because of what we were born with and what we experienced growing up.
5 Nov #14 Parental influence: Our parents shape who we are in both visible and invisible ways.
10 Nov #15 Social influence: Our behavior is often influenced by actions by other people.
Theme 4: The dark and bright sides of our functioning
12 Nov #16 Abnormality: The boundary between what is normal and what is abnormal is fuzzy.
17 Nov #17 Psychological disorders: A better understanding of mental illness may reduce the stigma around it.
19 Nov #18 Psychotherapy: Therapists use a number of psychological techniques to treat psychological disorders.
24 Nov #19 Mind and body: A healthy mind boosts a healthy body.
26 Nov #20 Positive psychology: Happiness brings success, health and even longevity, but it has dark sides.
1 Dec Consultation
3 Dec Quiz 2

https://sosc.ust.hk/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/SOSC1960-L1-Discovering-Mind-and-Behavior_FALL-20-21-1.pdf

reviews.author: aiikooo
reviews.comment_content:
Interesting content. The course title is pretty self-explanatory: discovering mind and behavior. Learned about how the mechanism of the human mind, learning processes, social psychology, consciousness, memory, attachment, psychological disorders.

3-hr lecture with a 15-min break, 3 times a week.

2 quizzes, 2 assignments and class participation score makes up the final score. Quizzes are multiple-choice based on lectures and reading materials. Assignments are written and submitted online through canvas. Class participation score is taken randomly by writing down answers to her questions and submitting it after class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Lai's English is very fluent and easy to understand. Her lectures flow smoothly (sometimes a bit too smooth that I dozed off) and she explains things quite clearly. She encourages students to participate in the lecture by asking questions or conducting in-class activities. During the 15-min break, students come up to her with questions about the materials and she will answer one by one.
reviews.comment_grading: Gradings are a bit worse than I expected for the assignments. But it's better for two quizzes since they're both multiple choice.
reviews.comment_workload:
It's a bit heavy for the reading materials (textbook). She said the quiz will include materials from the reading materials and the textbook chapters are really really long it drains your energy to read all of those, especially if we don't know which one will appear.

The assignments are not too bad as long as you put some effort into it.

reviews.author: app_Sci
reviews.title: VERY VERY Chur, not a bad course, but not too good of a course either.
reviews.comment_content:
look in the course syllabus pdf provided. it gives a good insight on how the course is taught. Be prepared to have a very chur summer, the whole course is taught in 1 month.
Some contents not taught in class, but are present in the textbook will also be tested. So it's suggested to read the textbook if you have time. Stick to the ppts if you do not have the time.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Examples are given to illustrate various points in the lecture. There will be a short break in the middle of the lesson. Overall teaching not bad.
The problem is in how fast they grade our homework. They have only 3 TAs grading all your stuff. 1 TA grades attendance. 1 TA grades HW1, and the last one grades HW2. The course ended in around the 25th of July but I didn't get my score for HW 1&2 until August 15th. WTF!!!
It just takes too long.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are 2 quizzes (which are just like midterm and final), noncumulative, each about 30% of your grade. 40 MC for each quiz.
Two assignments. Each contributes 15% of the course grade.
Remaining 10% in attendance. Answering simple questions and writing short paragraphs after watching a video. I do not know if the performance in it counts.
They say it in a way that sounded like if you reached the word limit, no matter how crappy your work is, we will count it. I don't know if it is true tho (seems like its true).
Quiz 1: Mean 28.52/40, SD 5.19 (Me 30/40, above mean 0.28 SD)
Quiz 2: Mean 26.38/40, SD 5.85 (Me 26/40,  below mean 0.065 SD)
HW1: mean: 12.43/15 SD: 2.43/15 (me 12/15, below mean 0.2x-ish SD)
HW2: mean: 10.16/15 SD: 1.93/15 (me 9/15 (WTF?!), below mean 0.6-ish SD)
Attendance: 8/8 (no stats)
overall mean: 73.765/100 (assuming attendance 8/8, my mark is 73/100)
seems like overall I should be around or above mean (just a little bit). Expected a C+ or a B-. B if the grade is really lenient. Got a B-. Not bad, but not too good either.
reviews.comment_workload:
The assignments are not that big of a workload actually. Both have a word limit of 400, and more than 450 will result in mark deduction, so you don't have to write all that much.
The main workload comes from reviewing PPT and reading the book. You are essentially studying 3 week's content in 1 week, very chur.

reviews.author: cllamx
reviews.comment_content: Basically a crash course in psychology. 2 lectures every week and topic covers from scientific research methods to positive psychology. Students who are interested in Psychology are recommended to take this course as you will obtain basic knowledge of this field.
reviews.comment_teaching: Even though the professor's tone was rather flat, you could see that he tried very hard to make his lectures more interesting. I actually think his lectures were thought-provoking. Several video clips were shown in every class, and there were also class activities. For instance, for the last lesson, he asked us what would we do if we have won a million dollars, and brought the message that you should actually spend money on others to be happier. I didn't fell asleep in lectures even though it was a 0900 class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm and final (30%)
Essay writing (20%)
Learning Reflection (10% and you will secure an 8 out of 10 as long as you hand in on time and didn't exceed the word limit)
Research Participation (10% and you will secure a full score as long as you have participated in 3)

Personally
Midterm: above 0.7 sd
Final: above 0.5 sd
Essay writing: above 1 sd
Learning reflection: 9/10
Research Participation: 10/10
Final Grade: B+

I was actually a bit disappointed that I couldn't get an A range this course. But as long as you study all the powerpoints before the exam, you'll be fine.
reviews.comment_workload:
I would say the workload is appropriate.
1 essay writing, A Midterm and final, a learning reflection and participation in 3 Psychology research. There was word limit for both writing task, and both midterm and final were in MC. No attendance was taken for lectures and no tutorials.  Recommended readings and further readings were given only for your information, and all you have to do is to study all the ppt in each lecture before exams.

reviews.comment_content:
I don't want to copy, you can simply see what other students write in this section.

Required Textbook:
Feldman, R. S. (2015). Understanding Psychology (12 edition)

Some reminder:
1. The textbook can be borrowed from the public library, although they are in old edition, they can still handle the course.

2. Powepoints are somehow messy, you may need to refer to the textbook for details.

3. Some questions appear in both quizzes can only be found in the textbook but not in the powerpoint. But you may make some logical guess.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Sexy voice with good English pronunciation. She is willing to answer your questions during the break.

She provided some videos for us to watch in order to raise our interest in psychology. She also used some questionnaires or psychological tests for taking attendance.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1 (30%): Mean 21.85 SD: 3.91;  I get 23.25/30
Quiz 2: (30%): Mean = 20.83 SD = 4.39;  I get 23.25/30
Assignment 1 (15%): Mean: 12.31 SD: 2.33;  I get 15/15
Assignment 2 (15%): Mean: 10.37 SD: 2.12;  I get 11/15
Class Participation: 10%, I skip nearly half of the lessons

Final Grade: B

Since the class has 400 students, it is expected the grade is strictly followed by the normal distribution. I think it is quite normal for getting a B, given that all my tasks are above mean within 0.5 SD.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 assignments which required a lot of research from the Internet and the textbook.

Since the word count for both assignments are only 400 words, you have to summarize the key points very well with detail explanation.

reviews.author: I Want 1st Hon!
reviews.title: Mostly useful contents! Heavy Workload & Bad Grade!
reviews.comment_content:
This course is like an introduction to psychology. Some of the contents are quite fun while some are not!  Remember it is an extremely competitive course! Choose wisely!
I don't think the lecture notes are really well-made. Hence, you may have to pay attention in lecturers carefully AND/OR read textbooks by yourself to understand broadly...

Course content:
Lecture 1 Introduction
Lecture 2 Research Methods
Lecture 3 Memory
Lecture 4 Learning
Lecture 5 Sensation and Perception
Lecture 6 Social Psychology
Lecture 7 Quiz 1 (L1-6)

Lecture 8 States of Consciousness
Lecture 9 Intelligence
Lecture 10 Development
Lecture 11 Personality
Lecture 12 Health Psychology
Lecture 13 Psychological Disorders
Lecture 14 Quiz 2 (L8-13)

Reminder:
1. Reading textbook is required (~15% quiz questions)
2. You may download online (if available) or buy it at the bookstore!!
3. Some quiz questions follow past-papers
4. All quizzes are MC type! (40 questions)
5. Make-up quizzes will be in form of essays!
6. Six attendances taken!  (3 before the quiz 1, 3 after the quiz 1)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Lai is willing to teach, listen and answer your questions. She has good accent and explains concepts clearly. She always gives useful examples (some are from the textbooks).

She takes attendance by giving you survey, MC answer sheets, or drawing tests. She encourages us think and discuss at the appropriate time! Although it doesn’t matter what you write, NEVER leave it blank!!!

Some students ask a bunch of questions and that stimulates us thinking. Also, by answering those questions, Dr. Lai clarifies some misconception of some students.

She teaches in both fast and moderate paces, only overruns once. She had once finished a lecture 10 minutes before the normal time. Each lecture, there is a 15-25 minutes break!!! Even though she always said 15 minutes break, it is actually 20 minutes or more!!! ^ ^
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1 (30%): Mean 21.85 SD: 3.91;  I get 21/30
Quiz 2: (30%): Mean = 20.83 SD = 4.39;  I get 23.25/30

Assignment 1 (15%):
Our memory is not perfect and all of us have experienced instances of forgetting. Psychologists have come up with different theories to explain why our memory fails. Choose ONE recent situation in which you forgot (and later remembered) something important. Describe it briefly and show how each of these theories of forgetting (Level of processing + Decay + Interference + Cue dependent forgetting) would explain your memory lapse.
Use the working template to write your answers. Describe your situation in the “Scenario” box. In the corresponding boxes, demonstrate and explain why you forgot and how you could have avoided forgetting based on each theory.

The tutor gives useful comments afterwards!
Mean: 12.31 SD: 2.33;  I get 13/15

Assignment 2 (15%):
Pokemon Go was very popular when it first came out two years ago. Using concepts and/or theories you have learned in social psychology, why do you think this game was so popular around the world when it first came out?

The tutor gives nearly useless comments afterwards
Mean: 10.37 SD: 2.12;  I get 12/15

Class Participation: 10% I attend all lectures (10/10)!

Overall: 79.25/100; Grade: B!!
I expect a B+!!!But anyway, I think the grade is not lenient!
reviews.comment_workload:
Moderate to Heavy!!
Two weeks given to finish each assignment
Maximum 400 words for each assignment

The hardest part is to read the textbooks….> <
It really takes a lot of time!!
While I know some students who don’t read textbooks, they get very high marks too. It really depends on the level of understanding!!!

Most important part is searching for past-papers as I have mentioned!
Hence, revise all past-papers and sample papers, and understand thoroughly!!

reviews.comment_workload:
Exams: Both are 40 MCs and the content are not cumulative. I recommend spending 1-2 days on midterm and 2-3 days on final exam. I spend 1-2 days on both exam but it turns out I can only revise 2/3 content for the final exam which accounts for my great discrepancy between midterm and final exam result. You need to spend some time reading textbooks.

Assignment: 1-3 hours on each assignment depending on your ability.

Attendance: Somewhat hard workload since the lessons starts at 9:00am. They are usually taken at ~10:00am but sometimes earlier. They are either worksheets or PRS.

reviews.comment_grading:
1. Lectures ILOs #1, #2, #3
 Lectures provide information you will need to complete the course successfully. Past studies have shown that lecture attendance and participation facilitate learning and predict course grades.
 Your participation in the course is essential to building a positive, productive learning atmosphere, and will help facilitate your own learning as well. We will use group discussions and activities to encourage participation and gauge your progress in class.
2. Examinations (20% + 20% + 20%) ILOs #1, #2
 Each examination covers the following topics:
- Exam 1: Research Methods, Memory, Learning, Sensation and Perception (20%)
- Exam 2: Development, Intelligence, Personality, Social Psychology (20%)
- Exam 3: States of consciousness, Psychological Disorders, Treatment of Psychological Disorders, Health and Well-Being (20%)
 Everything covered in the lectures may be tested on the exams, but not supplementary material that is only on the course website. Exams 1 and 2 will be held during class, and Exam 3 will be arranged by ARRO. All three exams include multiple-choice questions only.
 Do arrive at the exam sessions on time. No additional time will be given to students who arrive late.
 Absentees will not be granted a make-up exam, except in the case of critical medical conditions. Doctor’s testimony must be provided. The make-up exam will consist of essay questions only.
 More guidelines will be disseminated in due course.
3. Paper Assignment (2% + 8% + 20%) ILO #1, #2
 The paper assignment consists of three parts:
- Part 1: completion of a “Test Your Mindset” online quiz (2%)
- Part 2: participation of an in-class paper assignment activity (8%)
- Part 3: submission of an individual paper (20%)
 Parts 1 and 2 are designed to ensure your understanding of the material from the paper assignment workshop (October 13) and to prepare you for writing the individual paper.
 Part 3 will consist of one question. You will analyze the topic described and write a response (maximum 800 words).
4. Research participation (10%)
