reviews.author: Kabul
reviews.title: Excellent teaching, stupid exams.
reviews.comment_content:
Exam 1️⃣ Topics:
🔷 Research methods
🔶 Memory
🔶 Learning
🔶 Sensation and perception

Exam 2️⃣ Topics:
🔷 Development
🔶 Intelligence
🔶 Personality
🔶 Social psychology

Exam 3️⃣ Topics:
🔶 States of consciousness
🔶 Psychological disorders
🔶 Treatment of psychological disorders
🔷 Health and well-being

🔷 Topics taught with 1 lecture
🔶 Topics taught with 2 lectures

The content was quite interesting. It covered topics which are pretty useful in our daily lives.

The lecture ppts are very well made. They highlight a few important concepts in each slide and they are always shown in a very neat manner.
reviews.comment_teaching: Eva talks in a very playful way. She has a good grasp of English and always manages to make the atmosphere very relaxing.
reviews.comment_grading:
Exams suck. They require you the memorize research results as well as the names of the researchers which are pointless. There are also questions asking about the contents of video clips which are only played in the lectures and not accessible in Canvas. Though I attended all the lectures, there are no ways I can revise them before the exams.

Among the worst are questions like in which year explicitly homosexuality was no longer regarded as a psychological disorder in the DSM, or questions like in which option most students in the lecture hall raised their hands... WHAT THE FUCK!!! Who would the heck spend time memorizing these stupid facts?

Eva simply likes to ask any random fact in the lecture notes and videos which seem to deviate a lot from the main points she conveyed in class. Thus, you'd better look into EVERY random fact hidden in the lecture notes during your revision, even though she didn't even mention in class.

Exams mean were pretty high.
✏️ 1st exam: 40 / 50 (20%)
      Mean = 36.9 / 50
      SD = 5.86
✏️ 2nd exam: 42 / 50 (20%)
      Mean = 38.35 / 50
      SD = 5.99
✏️ Essay: 12 / 12 (30%)
      Mean = 9.79 / 12
      SD = 1.79
✏️ 3rd exam: 41 / 50 (20%)
      Mean = 35.06 / 50
      SD = 6.21
🏫 Research Participation: 10/10 (10%)
🏫 1 bonus mark for attendance in the writing workshop.

Overall: 90.2%
💯 Final Grade: A

Year 1 students need to beware the high mean score and a lot of competitive fellow students who take this course in the final year. You know my feeling when I faced fierce competition from the senior students - a common problem when year-1 students aren't supposed to be able to enroll in such a popular course. So DON'T be excited when u luckily manage to have a place in the class as a year-1 student. It's actually the beginning of ur nightmare... One of my friends got C+ and another friend got a D cuz they got well below mean in the essay.
reviews.comment_workload:
Heavy workload if you don't like writing, but otherwise it's gonna be a piece of cake for you.

It requires you to submit an 800-word essay addressing several questions or issues raised by an essay prompt. Integration of concepts from different lectures is required and you definitely have to spend much time on it. Sometimes the situation is quite ambiguous and you might have to burn your brain to make sure EVERY concept in the essay is correctly applied. If any wrong concept appears, your essay will definitely score VERY low. The word limit cannot be exceeded or otherwise marks deducted, and you'll have to address all the questions thoroughly with concrete examples, evidence and some research within the word limit. I spent so much time in cutting the number of words and it was a nightmare. But at the end the essay turned out to be the savior of my grade.

In addition to the essays, there are a total of three exams. Though they are all MC questions, it doesn't mean the exams are easy. I spent several weeks on revising the lecture ppts but still did not get a very good result in the exams.

As a tip of ur revision, cuz all exams are in MCs, there is no need for u to completely memorize all those fancy terms and names. All u need to do is to recognize the first 3 alphabetical letters of each name and as soon as u can recognize and differentiate different concepts, and u understand wut they are, then u're done. It all tests ur ability to RECOGNIZE but not RECALL.

Another component of the course is research participation which accounts for 10% of the course grade. It was the worst sh!t of my life cuz it was really hard to enroll in one. After I received the research email I immediately rushed to the SONA website to register, but still... DAMN!!! "Timeslot is already full..." You can never imagine why all the other people can grab all the places sooooo FAST!!!
